body:
The company announced its last quarter financial performance results on 11/02/2016. Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) belongs to Computer and Technology sector that surged 1.63% in value when last trading session closed at $131.48. The company has a market capitalization of $380.47 Billion. The company’s stock has a Return on Assets (ROA) of 13.8 percent, a Return on Equity (ROE) of 15.3 percent and Return on Investment (ROI) of 8.4 percent. The company reached its 52-Week high of $133.5 on Oct 25, 2016 and 52-Week low of $96.82 on Feb 9, 2016.

Earnings per share (ttm) for Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) according to Finviz Data is $2.59.

The growth estimate for Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) for the current quarter is 65.8 percent. The projected growth estimate for the next quarter is 39 percent. The company’s stock has grown by 68.85 percent in the past 5 years. For the next 5 years, the company is expected to grow by 35.45 percent.

This company was Upgrade by Raymond James on 13-Jan-17  to Strong Buy.

The 41 analysts offering 12-month price forecasts for Facebook have a median target of 155.00, with a high estimate of 180.00 and a low estimate of 90.00. The median estimate represents a +17.89% increase from the last price of 131.48.

Following Earnings result, share price were UP 10 times out of last 17 Qtrs. In the last 27 earnings reports, the company has topped earnings-per-share estimates 58% percent of times. It has met expectations  1 times and missed earnings  4  times.

The consensus recommendation for Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) is 1.27. The rating scale runs from 1 to 5 with 5 indicating a Strong Sell, 1 indicating a Strong Buy and 3 indicating a Hold. The consensus recommendation 30 days ago for this company stood at 1.32. In comparison, the consensus recommendation 60 days ago was at 1.27, and 90 days ago was at 1.26 respectively.

When the current quarter ends, Wall Street expects Facebook, Inc. to have earnings per share of $1.31.

Revenue is expected to range from 8.16 Billion to 8.71 Billion with an average of 8.49 Billion.

Facebook Inc. operates a social networking website worldwide. The Company’s products for users are free of charge and available on the Web, mobile Web, and mobile platforms, such as Android and iOS. Its website enables users to connect, share, discover, and communicate with each other. The Facebook Platform is a set of tools and application programming interfaces that developers can use to build social apps on Facebook or to integrate their Websites with Facebook. It offers products that enable advertisers and marketers to engage with its users. Facebook Inc. is headquartered in Menlo Park, California.

Barrick Gold Corporation (NYSE:ABX) belongs to Basic Materials sector closed its last session with a loss of -0.39 percent and closed its previous trading session at $18.06. According to Finviz reported data, the stock currently has Earnings per Share (EPS) (ttm) of $-2.05. The company has the Market capitalization of $21.04 Billion. The company’s stock has a Return on Assets (ROA) of -9.3 percent, a Return on Equity (ROE) of -32.8 percent and Return on Investment (ROI) of -13.5 percent. The company reached its 52-Week high of $23.47 on Jul 6, 2016 and 52-Week low of $9.3 on Jan 28, 2016.

The growth estimate for Barrick Gold Corporation (NYSE:ABX) for the current quarter is 137.5 percent. The projected growth estimate for the next quarter is 63.6 percent. The company’s stock has grown by -45.84 percent in the past 5 years. For the next 5 years, the company is expected to grow by 36.85 percent.

This company was Downgrade by TD Securities on 21-Dec-16 to Hold.

The 25 analysts offering 12-month price forecasts for Barrick Gold Corp have a median target of 20.00, with a high estimate of 24.00 and a low estimate of 13.70. The median estimate represents a +10.74% increase from the last price of 18.06.

Following Earnings result, share price were UP 10 times out of last 11 Qtrs. In the last 27 earnings reports, the company has topped earnings-per-share estimates 58% percent of times. It has met expectations  3  times and missed earnings  2  times.

The consensus recommendation for Barrick Gold Corporation (NYSE:ABX) is 2.71. The rating scale runs from 1 to 5 with 5 indicating a Strong Sell, 1 indicating a Strong Buy and 3 indicating a Hold. The consensus recommendation 30 days ago for this company stood at 2.69. In comparison, the consensus recommendation 60 days ago was at 2.69, and 90 days ago was at 2.88 respectively.

When the current quarter ends, Wall Street expects Barrick Gold Corporation to have earnings per share of $0.19.

Revenue is expected to range from 1.88 Billion to 2.48 Billion with an average of 2.19 Billion.

Barrick Gold Corporation is a leading international gold producer with low-cost mines in North and South America.
title: Worth Observing Stocks: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB), Barrick Gold Corporation (NYSE:ABX)
